Content: Every student in the Biological Sciences program at CMUQ is assigned a departmental advisor to help plan courses, approve exceptions (placement exams, honors theses, senior research), guide drop/add decisions, ensure full-time status, sign off on exchange applications, and monitor probation recovery. Advisors also serve as bridges to campus resources for non-academic needs.

The ARC offers workshops (note-taking, time management, QPA forecasting, study planning) and tutoring in entry-level math, programming, and basic science courses. Main Contact: Mariamma Thomas (mariamma@qatar.cmu.edu).
Handles visas, housing, emergency financial support, clubs and activities, and community standards. Main Contacts: Dalia Rehal (drehal@andrew.cmu.edu) and Sheila Ryan (srian@qatar.cmu.edu).
Supports physical and mental health. Physical Health: Amie Rollins (Amier@andrew.cmu.edu). Mental Health: Atorina Benjamin (atorinab@qatar.cmu.edu).
Assists with CV/resume writing, interview prep, employer connections, career fairs, internships, and graduate-study planning. Main Contact: Mohammed Mirza (mohammem@qatar.cmu.edu).
For students needing extra coaching (study strategies, regular check-ins, goal setting), contact Damian Dourado (ddourado@qatar.cmu.edu), cc'ing the Associate Area Head.

Subheading: Associate Area Head and Area Head
Content: For exceptional cases (risk of delayed graduation, prolonged underperformance), the Associate Area Head or Area Head can propose solutions or exceptions and involve the Associate Dean for Education (Dudley Reynolds, dreynolds@cmu.edu).

To earn the B.S. in Biological Sciences at CMUQ students must complete:

• **Core Biology**: 03-151 or 03-121; 03-201; 03-220 or 03-221; 03-231 or 03-232; 02-250; 03-320; 03-343; 03-344 or 03-345 or 03-346; 03-411; 03-412.

• **Chemistry Sequence**: 09-105 or 09-107 (A in 09-107 waives 09-106); 09-106; 09-217; 09-218; 09-207; 09-208.

• **Biology Electives**: Six 03-xxx courses, ≥18 units at 300-level or above (excluding 03-445/03-545); up to three interdisciplinary electives; up to 36 units of 03-445/03-545 research may count; cross-registration permitted with prior approval.

• **General Education & Core Seminars**: EUREKA!, Third-Year Seminar; Engage in Wellness I–III; one Cultural/Global; four non-technical electives; free electives to reach 360 units.

Consult your Biological Sciences advisor for sequencing, double-counting rules, and transfer credit approvals.
Pass/Fail deadline policies; passed units count toward graduation; factorable units count in QPA; full-time status is ≥36 units.

• **Pass/Fail**: change before deadline.
• **Passed units**: count toward graduation total.
• **Factorable units**: count in QPA.
• **Full-time**: ≥36 units per term (including mini-courses).
Dropping removes the course and its units. Grades that count toward 'load' may or may not be factorable; only A–R and X enter QPA calculations.
Guidance on deadlines, unit counting, and voucher usage for late drops or pass/fail options.
Three per degree; each allows drop or P/NP until last day of classes. Advisor initiates via S3; student confirms within 24 hours.
Only one set of units per course counts toward graduation; independent studies and theses may count separately.
Advisors can view and advise on waitlist status in S3. Resolved by Associate Area Head; schedule conflicts must be cleared before enrollment.
Over 52 units per term requires advisor and Dietrich College petition; full-load and overload policies follow CMUQ guidelines.
3–12 units under Biology faculty sponsorship; apply by week 1 with approved scope and grading criteria.
Seminar-style courses (3–6 units, P/F or letter) on special topics; apply early each semester.
Partner-institution courses (e.g., Qatar University) require advisor and registrar approval; credits transfer via Scotty form.

• **Probation**: QPA < 2.0 or lack of progress; recovery plans required.
• **Suspension**: two consecutive terms below threshold.
• **Expulsion**: non-compliance with probation terms.
Consult with your advisor and Biological Sciences Program Coordinator; submit Change of Major via Scotty; carefully plan for credit impacts.
Options include Computational Biology, Data Science, or interdisciplinary majors; discuss with advisor and ARC for implications on timeline.
Apply one semester in advance for Pittsburgh or partner-campus exchange; maintain ≥ 3.0 QPA; credits evaluated on return.
Declare programs and certify schedules each term in S3 (Student Services → Academic Records → Certification); failure may lead to dropped courses.

• Biological Sciences – 03-xxx
• Computational Biology – 02-xxx
• Chemistry – 09-xxx
• NOTE: Independent research numbers (07-xxx) may also apply

• Head, Biological Sciences Department – [Name TBD]
• Program Coordinator, Biological Sciences – [Name TBD]
• Associate Dean for Education – Dudley Reynolds
• Other advising staff as listed on CMUQ website
Offered degrees: B.S. in Biological Sciences (with or without Options), Additional Major in Biological Sciences, Dual Degree pathways, Minors in related fields.
Free fifth-year at CMUQ to explore new fields: https://www.cmu.edu/student-affairs/dean/fifth/
